messages.message: Following up Hamish's observation around the ChatBot API, there is currently no way to retrieve the last version of the chatbot. If used via integration, we have to hardcode the chatbot ID, and when / if updated, the integration then fails as the URL changed.

This is a problem that we are trying to solve but were not able to prioritize it. The way we handle this internally is that for a given chatbot the combination of name and owner is always unique therefore we have APIs which can use this combination to get the latest version but I think they are not documented for external use. Lmk if you need them I can help with those APIs!
cc: @Balaram @Gauti
@Gauti can you confirm on this? If the chatbot is shared, we should redirect to the new URL
I think he is mentioning APIs specifically and not UI, in the queries API I don't think we fetch the latest version. @Gauti Please correct me if I am wrong.
Even in the API, we have handled this
My bad, yes we do it just checked again missed it the first time. :man-bowing:
hmm ... I got an error 403 if it was supposed to redirect :confused:  I ll try again tomorrow with an "expired" chatbot
We will validate once from our end and post an update here
